intro: Ponapea kusaiensis, commonly known as the Kusai Island hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough texture. Ponapea kusaiensis is often found growing in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and humid environments.
